cerf.process_inputs package¶

Submodules¶

cerf.process_inputs.process_expansion module¶

class cerf.process_inputs.process_expansion.ProcessExpansion(expansion_plan_file, scenario, target_yr, target_techs, tech_dict, primary_zone_dict, expansion_plan_xml_dir, output_csv=False)¶

Bases: object

Convert expected electricity capacity plan to CERF XML format.

Parameters

  • expansion_plan_file – Full path with file name and extension of input expansion plan file.

  • scenario – Name of the target scenario.

  • target_yr – Four digit year to extract.

  • target_techs – List of technologies to include in the expansion plan.

  • tech_dict – Dictionary of {cerf_technology_name: cerf_technology_id}

  • primary_zone_dict – Dictionary of {cerf_state_abbreviation: cerf_state_id}

  • expansion_plan_xml_dir – Full path to the directory to save the expansionplan.xml file to.

  • output_csv – Boolean. Choose to save a copy to of the expansion plan as a CSV file. Default is False.

static build_expansion_plan_xml_row(row)¶

Construct rows for the expansionplan.xml file.

Parameters

row – Data frame row containing input data.

Returns

XML formatted row.

static check_idx(variable, idx, delim)¶

Split expansion variable by delimiter. Return ‘none’ as string if the requested subcategory is not present. Otherwise, return the name of the requested.

Parameters

  • variable – The variable string to parse.

  • idx – The index number to parse.

  • delim – The variable string delimiter.

Returns

‘none’ if index not present, else the name.

check_tech(exp_techs)¶

Make sure technologies expected by the user are in the expansion plan. If not, report.

Parameters

  • target_techs – List of the target technologies desired by desired by the user.

  • exp_techs – List of technologies in the expansion plan.

process_expansion_plan()¶

Convert expected electricity capacity plan to CERF XML format.

Parameters

  • expansion_plan_file – Full path with file name and extension of input expansion plan file.

  • scenario – Name of the target scenario.

  • target_yr – Four digit year to extract.
